TopicTitle: Why don't I have the Wheesly when I have the Juno?

Articles.Content:
I got the 'Aviation' Tech Node, which includes both the Wheesly and the Juno, but I don't have the Wheesly in the SPH. Why is that?
[URL="http://imgur.com/a/O1RIY"][IMGUR]O1RIY[/IMGUR][/URL] Edited November 18, 2015 by xiej

[quote name='xiej']I got the 'Aviation' Tech Node, which includes both the Wheesly and the Juno, but I don't have the Wheesly in the SPH. Why is that?
[URL]http://imgur.com/a/O1RIY[/URL]
How do I post an album?[/QUOTE]

I can't help with your question, but you post an album like:

[.IMGUR]O1RIY[./IMGUR] (minus the periods. notice the last digits on your imgur link)

Is this an old save?

Jet engines (among other things) were moved around in the tech tree, so you might have unlocked a node that used to have the wheesley in it but now does not.

Check to see if the wheesley also shows up in a later node.

Supernovy: The Wheesley is in the same node as the juno, in the picture
VenusGate: Thanks!

[quote name='xiej']Supernovy: The Wheesley is in the same node as the juno, in the picture[/QUOTE]

It goes like this:

- You unlock the node with the Wheesley in it.
- The game writes that fact into the persistent.sfs savegame file, listing the node that was unlocked and all the parts that it included.
- You upgrade KSP to a new version. The Wheelsey engine gets moved to a different tech node.
- You load your savegame. The view in the R&D facility is populated with data from your savegame. The savegame says that when that tech node was unlocked, it had the Wheesley engine in it (and that is correct).
- However, you still do not have access to the Wheesley, because you are now playing a different version of the game, and you need a different tech node as a prerequisite for it, which you do not yet have.


Solution: unlock the tech node that [I]now[/I], in the new version, actually does have the Wheesley in it. It should be the one directly after the one with the Juno in it.
